markdown: '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a [quest](/pillarsOfEternityIiDeadfireQuestsBeastOfWinter/) in {{bow}}. It activates automatically after the DLC is activated and the player enters the world map. ## Synopsis High Harbinger [Vatnir](/vatnir/), leader of a [Rymrgand](/rymrgand/) cult out in [The Dead Floe](/theDeadFloe/), has invited the Watcher to a feast in their honor, so that they may honor Rymrgand impending dominion over Eora. The Watcher decides to come. ## Walkthrough * The quest is activated by the [wax-sealed letter](/waxSealedLetter/) that's automatically delivered to you once on the world map. If you've just started the game, this occurs after finishing [Stranded](/stranded/) upon leaving [Vilario's Rest](/vilariosRest/) on your ship. * To begin, simply head south-east, past the Windless Waste, to the newly-marked [Harbinger's Watch](/harbingersWatch/). After a run-in with an excited Harbinger, proceed to [Harbingers' Retreat](/harbingersRetreat/) in the center of the map. * Inside, you are greeted by [Harbinger Valbrendhür](/harbingerValbrendhur/), who gives out a free set of Harbinger robes. Your goal, [Vatnir](/vatnir/), is in the northwest. He will introduce you as the Duskspeaker, allowing you to react in a variety of ways, including a special option for [Clergy](/clergy/) with [Deception](/deception/) 8. * Then he will proceed by listing your accomplishments, including a rather, uh, skewed view of the events of {{poe1}}, up to and including pinning the Hollowborn curse on the Watcher. Perfect. You can reply with a special option, [Religion](/religion/) 15, or just go ahead and skip to the feast. Except there shall be no feast, as something called [The Messenger](/theMessenger/) appears in the Watch, leading to Vatnir's cultists tripping over each other on the way out the door. * Exit the temple after this peculiar introduction to be introduced to an even more interesting character: A dracolich. After several strafing runs over the village, killing a dozen or so Harbingers - much to their delight - the dragon will land and await your approach. Due to its state, the dragon can't speak - or doesn't want to - and will attack after a short exchange. After dispatching it, head back into the Retreat. * Vatnir can be found cowering in his secret room, accessed through his quarters and a hidden switch in the skull. After talking to him, you'll learn that Vatnir basically invented the Messenger as a way to explain the dragon's raids on the Watch - and isn't actually the fanatical zealot he appears to be. He will suggest looking for answers in the [The Rimebound Temple](/theRimeboundTemple/), which the Dead Floe grew around. You can obtain Vatnir as a companion with 12 Deception, 9 Streetwise, 11 Religion or 11 Metaphysics, or tell him that he has to set things right. Either way, [Harbinger Hafjórn](/harbingerHafjorn/) will appear, and after exchanging a couple of perplexed lines with Vatnir, get an untimely promotion to deputy High Harbinger. ## Journal {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="3" style="word-break:break-all" | Quests/LAX02_01_Iceberg_Dungeon/LAX02_qst_critical_path_quest_01.quest |- ! width="40px" | {{tooltip|ID|Objectives: 0, Descriptions: 10000, Addenda: 20000, End states: 30000, Alternate descriptions: 40000}} ! colspan="2" | Objectives |- | rowspan="4" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''0''' | colspan="2" | '''An Honored Guest''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10000 | A letter sealed with the symbol of the god Rymrgand arrived for me. I should read it. |- | colspan="2" style="text-align:center" | '''Alternate descriptions''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 40001 | A group called the Harbingers of Dusk have invited me to a feast in my honor at Harbingers' Watch in the Dead Floe. |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''1''' | colspan="2" | '''Read the wax-sealed letter.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10001 | A messenger delivered a leather scroll sealed with the emblem of the aurochs to my ship. I should read it when I have a chance. |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''2''' | colspan="2" | '''Journey to Harbingers' Watch.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10002 | A group calling themselves the Harbingers of Dusk have invited me to attend a feast in my honor. I don't know who they are or exactly what they're celebrating me for. If I'm to find out, I must travel to Harbingers' Watch, the group's outpost at the Dead Floe - an expanding iceberg in the southern seas. |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''3''' | colspan="2" | '''Speak with Vatnir.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10003 | I've been informed that Vatnir, leader of the Harbingers of Dusk, can often be found preaching in a chapel located inside the settlement's central building. He should know why I've been summoned here. |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''4''' | colspan="2" | '''Investigate the disturbance outside.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10004 | Vatnir's sermon on my role in the end of the world and death of all things was interrupted by a loud commotion outside. The Harbingers were strangely elated by the noise. I should find out what's going on. |- | rowspan="3" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''5''' | colspan="2" | '''Find Vatnir in Harbingers' Retreat.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10005 | Vatnir never made it outside. Now that I've slain the Harbingers' messenger - a decaying dragon - I should find the godlike and ask him what's going on. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20000 | Vatnir is no longer in the sanctuary, but since I didn't see him outside, he must still be within Harbingers' Retreat. |- ! colspan="3" | End states |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30000 | I exposed Vatnir to the Harbingers as a fraud. He fled, but not before mentioning a temple deep within the iceberg - a temple containing a tear in the fabric of reality that could serve as an entrance to the White Void. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30001 | Vatnir told me of a temple frozen deep within the iceberg. Supposedly this temple contains a tear in the fabric of reality - an entrance to the White Void. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30002 | I killed Vatnir. With his dying breath, he mentioned a temple within the iceberg containing a tear in the fabric of reality - an entrance to the White Void. |}
